question:
If the formula for converting degrees Fahrenheit to degrees Celsius is \(C= \frac{5}{9}(F-32)\), what is the value of F when C is 30?
(A) \(\frac{-10}{9}\)
(B) \(\frac{338}{9}\)
(C) \(86\)
(D) \(\frac{558}{5}\)
(E) \(112\)
